_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The reason for the request for a new Facility ID Number, and this first-time RMP submission to EPA is due to the introduction of new management personnel and understanding of the RMP rule.  Chelan Manson Fruit, LLC is the owner of this property which is managed and operated by Chelan Fruit Co-operative who own neighboring plants as well.  The Chelan Fruit Co-op has reported their RMP to EPA under Facility ID: 100000147833, commonly known as Chelan Facility.  Until their most recent re-submission dated 4/18/2018, the Chelan Facility RMP report included this subject property.  Because the properties are legally owned by two different entities, separate reporting is necessary.  This First Time Submission is made in an effort to establish separate reporting for two separate facilities.

Anhydrous ammonia is used on-site at the Chelan Manson Fruit facility.  Ammonia is considered hazardous by EPA and is listed on the Extremely Hazardous Substance list.  Chemical properties of ammonia make it necessary to observe certain safety precautions in handling ammonia in order to:  Prevent unnecessary human exposure; Reduce the threat to our personnel; and Reduce the threat to the community.  

The facility is a cold storage warehouse located near the City of Chelan, in the County of Chelan, State of Washington.

The regulated substance, anhydrous ammonia, is used as a refrigerant. There is approximately 14,412 pounds of ammonia in the overall facility which is approximately 137,200 sq ft warehouse with multiple vessels and extensive piping.  The largest vessel could potentially release 6,369 pounds of ammonia. There are no other hazardous substances on-site that meet or exceed the threshold limits established in 40 CFR 68.130.

The Accidental Release Prevention Program is based on the following:
Continuing training for personnel
Maintenance programs as described in the PSM program
Use of safety equipment and procedures
Use of accurate, effective written operating proc

edures, and
Intensive Mechanical Integrity program

Chelan Manson Fruit complies with OSHA and WA State process safety management rules and regulations, WA State safety regulations, and IIAR standards for good work practices.  The ammonia refrigeration system was installed to standards and local codes at the time of installation.  Piping and equipment are secured and protected, engine room doors are tight fitting and open outwards.  Other safety systems used include:
Computerized controls
Suction trap hi-level float
High discharge pressure shut down
Low suction pressure shut down
High discharge temperature shut down
Oil pressure failure shut down
High amperes shut down
Automatic timer to prevent short cycling via computer controls
Oil filters plugged shut down
250 psi relief valves on high pressure side, to prevent overpressure situations
150 psi relief valves on low pressure side, to prevent overpressure situations

Operating procedures and checklists have been prepared by Chelan Manson Fruit to be used by employees performing operational functions.  Procedures are kept in the refrigeration office.  These procedures include:
Shut down procedures (routine and emergency)
Pre-start up safety procedures
Routine operations
Maintenance of all equipment
Response to major and minor releases
Emergency action plan

Chelan Manson Fruit has had no accidents involving ammonia in the last five years.

In addition to operating procedures, Chelan Manson Fruit has established Emergency Response Guidelines for releases involving ammonia.  These procedures are part of the ongoing safety training.  The response plan is coordinated with Chelan County Fire District 7.

Training on ammonia safety and detailed mechanical integrity will be a major ongoing process at Chelan Manson Fruit, LLC.  Review and update of the emergency plan will be done annually.  Drills and emergency evacuation practices will be executed semi-annually.  Training will be required for all

employees who work around the ammonia system, including fork lift personnel.  Safety relief valves are scheduled for installation on all condensers immediately.  Proper eyewash showers will be installed in the engine room, and a program for the inspection and replacement of rusty pipe will be instituted and carried out immediately.
